column4: Where can I get help with an application I can't get to launch/install? (Aptana 1.5)
try asking in here, exactly what is the problem?
Deathfox -- side by side install with the live disc
-- I downloaded the Standalone for linux from the website, but it is an exe and wine doesn't launch it for some reason
-- I'm wondering if the file download is wrong... and why it won't do anything when I try to launch the exe with wine. (two seperate issues, but one solution would be fine)
get an unix compatible app alternative! :) but if u must have that app.. well check if wine is working at all
and are you sure that the program will work in wine? but first of all make sure wine works as intended
-- Aptana is the opensource alternative to dreamweaver, but it's downloaded as a exe for some odd reason -- wine is working for other apps, currently.
deathfox -- yes it over writes the boot loader -- but you can get windows to reclaim it if you want to later.
deathfox -- windows can re-create the bootloader with a windows vista disc.
get the unix version, I just downloaded it and its not an exe
-- ah! thank you... I didn't even think to check for a unix standalone.
and check if there is a already working binary package for ubuntu in some repo
hehe yw
-- I checked repos ... not on any for some reason :-\
thats really wierd, you should contact the package responsible ppl
-- also a good idea. thanks.
if its open source and free it should be in the repo imo..
:) ok
for all I know aptana is in the archlinux user repository, not sure if its compatible with ubuntu (im an arch user mostly)
-- okay.
and have you checked the universe repo?
-- as far as I know I have universe enabled all the time. I can double check though.
oh, I wasnt sure if its commonly used or not
